poem:
### A Morning Missive

The morning veil lifts—  
newspaper ink staining fingers,  
distant echoes of boots and bombs,  
Putin's war-torn whispers  
threading through early light.

Chessboard squares,  
nations in check,
pawns pushed.
The kettle whistles,  
a fragile symphony  
in a world on the verge.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "First Thing: Putin warns Nato over Ukraine missiles Good morning. Vladimir Putin has said that a western move to let Kyiv use long-range weapons against targets inside Russia would mean Nato would be “at war” with Moscow. Putin told a state television reporter: “This would in a significant way change the very nature of the conflict. It would mean that Nato countries, the US, European countries, are at war with Russia.” Putin’s made the statement". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
